technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.

questions.transcript: I was curious what was going through your mind when vaccines came out.
Now, did you have any reservations about getting the vaccine or?

And then what? Pushed you to ultimately get it? I know you mentioned. Your parents are kinda on the older side. But was it more to protect them yourself, or there any other kind of drivers behind you, deciding to get the back shade?
Definitely. And now, when you got it, what was your experience getting it?
Yeah, just very sick. I'm curious. Did you have anything similar, or is your experience? Easier.
Great, and now, how do you feel about the vaccine now that you've gotten it? Are your perceptions are around the vaccine changed, or even around Covid itself?
Now, when did you get Covid?
pretty light after. How was your experience?
Got it. And now so you got boosted your first 2 boosters, but not the overcrawn booster.
And what was your experience with the boosters? Kind of similar to vaccines?
And now why did you end up eventually getting boosted with it? Kind of your parents telling you to or.
Yeah. And now you didn't have any reservations about the booster, did you? Or?
Is? Is it hard or weird to think back on it?
I know it's normally not talked about so much, so curious kind of reflecting about this conversation, how you feel about it.
Well, I have one last question, which is, you know, given our conversation. I'm wondering what your decisions around vaccinations and boosters are going to be in the near future.

vaccine_importance: The participant expresses a generally positive view of vaccines, viewing them as a responsible measure and expressing relief when their parents were vaccinated.
booster_importance: The participant sees boosters as the 'responsible thing to do' during the pandemic, although they acknowledge that the urgency has faded as COVID-19 has become less prominent.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates cognitive complexity by acknowledging the initial uncertainty surrounding the pandemic, weighing the pros and cons of vaccination, and recognizing the evolving nature of the situation.
general_notes: The participant seems generally agreeable and willing to share their experiences. They express a sense of responsibility towards others and a desire to do the 'right thing' regarding vaccinations and boosters.
